page.title: 10LUDFORD GRANGE Continued
page.content: 60 years ago an acre yielded a ton of Barley _ today with better seed, weed_ killers & fertilisers 3 tons is the norm. 1985's wet summer would have been disastrous 60 years ago but with modern machinery a good harvest is assured. This immaculate farm produces Wheat, Barley, Oil Seed Rape & Peas. He employs no direct labour relying on his telephone to get sub contractors.b His 390 acres is all arable. Peas grown are sown & harvested by frozen food company who rent the land. It is said one crop in 1985 was grown excl_ _usively for the luxury liner Queen Elizabeth II. He allows Metal Detect_ _ors on land and finds have included Roman, Saxon & Viking coins & arte_ _facts and in 1985 a prehistoric stone hammer head. All finds to local Museum at Scunthorpe.
